title: JAM Session _1364 Is Your Bottom in That Seat Student Enrollment Verification Made Easier.pdf
docSource: pdf file uploaded by the user.
pageContent: © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Presented by Amanda Macias & Frank Connor  University of Saint Francis, Fort Wayne, IN  June 2, 2016  Is Your Bottom in That Seat?   #1364  Student Enrollment Verification Made Easier! © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  The University of Saint Francis is a private, Catholic university in the Franciscan tradition enrolling approximately 2,300 students and offers approximately 870 course sections.  Registrar’s Office includes 6 employees     1 Registrar     1 Associate Registrar/Data Manager     1 Associate Registrar/Student Services     1 Assistant Registrar     1 Assistant Data Manager     1 Advising Module Manager (half-time)  Franciscan Values:     Reverence the unique dignity of each person     Encourage a trustful, prayerful community of learners     Serve one another, society, and the Church     Foster peace and justice     Respect creation  About USF  3 campuses (enrollment #):  •   Main (1,850)  •   Crown Point, IN (160)  •   Virtual (300   )  Currently operate on EX 6.2.1 © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Roll Call! © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Timber!!     Typical fall semester (previously):  •   Print enrollment verification for each class using approximately 900+ pages per week x 2 weeks =1800+ pages of paper to verify enrollment.  •   Students signed forms once during week one and once during week two  •   Faculty turn those forms in to Registrar’s Office  •   Registrar’s Office would compare what was printed/signed on each form with Jenzabar’s class list © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Enter codes in the Grade Entry table, Days Absent column for students that were not present     3-4 week process for Registrar’s Office (usually just one person) to collect forms & enter this data     Run InfoMaker report to identify those that have not attended any classes during weeks 1 & 2     Contact those students to verify their intentions     Drop & back date those that are true no-shows and report them to the Business Office & Financial Aid before 5   th   week official stats  ...continued © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Fall 2013 USF moved official count from Friday of the 5   th   week to Friday of the 1   st   week. Our census date also changed from Friday of the 2   nd   week to Friday of the 1   st   week.  Our Procedure must change now!  “Lord, grant me the strength to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.”  ―   St. Francis of Assisi © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  So we got to thinking... © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Move enrollment verification to an online format     Using the Grade Entry portal in JICS  Turn on the column “Allow Absence Entry”  Solution © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Assign: “First Web Midterm Grades Date” on the   Year Term Subterm   table Year/Term   tab © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  continued © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Inform as many people as possible before classes begin  •   Deans  •   Department Chairs  •   Faculty  •   Adjunct  •   Administrative Assistants     Encourage early data entry (in class, on the very first day)  Communicate  Communicate  Communicate © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Other helpful tools to catch no-shows early  Jenzabar Retention Program with the Early Alert System  Invite communication (email, phone calls, reports) from other departments:     Admissions     Advisors     Athletics     Business Office     Financial Aid     Student Life, etc. © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Set Guidelines for entry   Every “class” must participate     Every student must be accounted for     1=absent, 99=present  Absent  Need to complete  Present © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Set a limit to the time faculty have to enter data     Thursday night of the first week     JICS administrator then unchecks the “Allows Absence Entry” box (refer back to slide #10).     This prevents changes from being made and saves and stabilizes the integrity of the data for reporting purposes © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Registrar’s Office analyzes the data gathered using an in-house report and determines students that are “no-shows”. These students are then dropped from courses before the official count is completed.  Notify Business Office and Financial Aid  Process R2T4  Enrollment Verification and Return to Title IV (R2T4) © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Proof of Success at USF  Overall     12 more students were found to be “no-shows” using the data collected from the faculty & adjunct (Fall 2013)     Student records were up-to-date and ready for official counts by 5:30p.m. on Friday of first week     No paper was used     Less time-consuming for all  Semester breakdowns     86.5% (very first semester, Fall 2013)     90.86 % Spring 2014     79.28 % Summer 2014     92.72% Fall 2014     92.03% Spring 2015     68.22% Summer 2015     86.01 % Fall 2015     88.96 % Spring 2016     Averaging 85.57% over 8 semesters © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Please take a few moments to complete the session survey:  https://www.jenzabarevents.com/jam/post_conference_eval.cfm © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Questions? © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.
